Detailed Description

Simple implementation of IHomogeneousMatrix44 interface.

Matrix can be set up either via manual rotation and translation coefficients or an Eigen2 transformation.

Definition at line 43 of file HomogeneousMatrix44.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

brics_3d::HomogeneousMatrix44::HomogeneousMatrix44 ( double  r0 = 1,
double  r1 = 0,
double  r2 = 0,
double  r3 = 0,
double  r4 = 1,
double  r5 = 0,
double  r6 = 0,
double  r7 = 0,
double  r8 = 1,
double  t0 = 0,
double  t1 = 0,
double  t2 = 0 
)

Constructor with rotation and translation coefficients.

Coefficient layout for rotation:
r0 r1 r2
r3 r4 r5
r6 r7 r8

Parameters:
r0Rotation coefficient 1,1
r1Rotation coefficient 1,2
r2Rotation coefficient 1,3
r3Rotation coefficient 2,1
r4Rotation coefficient 2,2
r5Rotation coefficient 2,3
r6Rotation coefficient 3,1
r7Rotation coefficient 3,2
r8Rotation coefficient 3,3
t0First translation coefficient
t1Second translation coefficient
t2Third translation coefficient

Default values are defined as the Identity matrix.

Member Function Documentation

const double * brics_3d::HomogeneousMatrix44::getRawData ( ) const [virtual]

Returns a pointer to a read-only buffer where the raw data of the matrix is stored.

Important: the 16 values are stored in column-row order! So the layout is:
0   4   8    12
1   5   9    13
2   6   10  14
3   7   11  15

Returns:
(Constant) pointer to buffer where the matrix is stored. Buffer has a size of 16 double values.

Implements brics_3d::IHomogeneousMatrix44.

bool brics_3d::HomogeneousMatrix44::isIdentity ( double  precision = 0.00001) [virtual]

Quick check if this matix is approximately an identity matrix.

Parameters:
precisionPrecision when matrix elemets are considered to be equal
Returns:
True if it is approximately an identity matrix.
